channel.title: Merging split pictures in a PDF
channel.description:
I have a dozen PDFs with pictures that I need to extract into separate files to study from. The problem is, the pictures are actually pieced together from several images, so that when I export them I get slivers of a picture, not the whole thing. Is there a way to merge the images in the PDF so that I get a clean extraction? Thanks.
If you like this is one of the PDFs. [url]https://www.mediafire.com/?cdeysdmwu1u9o5j[/url]

item.title: Merging split pictures in a PDF
item.dc:creator: FireTime
item.description:
export all pages to jpg then use Photoshops automation crop and straighten tool. it will grab the extra stuff but it should get most of them for you.

Read full topic
item.source: Merging split pictures in a PDF

item.title: Merging split pictures in a PDF
item.dc:creator: Combine
item.description:
I guess I’m not too keen on manually screenshoting each picture, as I have about 50 of these PDFs to do. 8 pages each, and about 4 images per page… it’s a lot of pictures to sort through manually.

I guess I’ll try it if nothing else works.

Read full topic
item.source: Merging split pictures in a PDF

item.title: Merging split pictures in a PDF
item.dc:creator: furon_117
item.description:
yeah id suggest doing that
